definition: to cover/to wrap/to hold/to include/to take charge of/to contract (to or for)/package/wrapper/container/bag/to hold or embrace/bundle/packet/CL:個|个[ge4],隻|只[zhi1]
to exchange/to change (clothes etc)/to substitute/to switch/to convert (currency)
replacement guaranteed if not genuine/fig. authentic

sentences.english: All our goods are guaranteed for one year.
sentences.chinese: 我们所有的商品一年内均包换。

sentences.english: Mr Grey bought his camera on approval.
sentences.chinese: 格雷先生买这架照相机，包退包换。

sentences.english: Quality assurance, shifting Baotui three months, so your peace of mind with.
sentences.chinese: 品质保证，三个月包换包退，让你用的安心。

sentences.english: One-month replacement, a one-year warranty and lifetime maintenance.
sentences.chinese: 一个月包换，一年保修，终身维护。

sentences.english: She is really an English woman.
sentences.chinese: 她是如假包换的英国女性。

sentences.english: We have the goods on appro for a week.
sentences.chinese: 我们这些货品一星期内包退包换。

sentences.english: We promise replacement within 6 months if any quality problems are found.
sentences.chinese: 如有质量问题，六个月内可包退包换。

sentences.english: Replaceable within three months from the date of sale.
sentences.chinese: 出售之日起三个月内包换。
这些都是如假包换的汽车，他说。

sentences.english: He bought the television set on approval.
sentences.chinese: 他购买了一台包退包换的电视机。

definition: to guarantee refund (for faulty or unsatisfactory goods)
to guarantee refund or replacement (of faulty or unsatisfactory goods)
lit. if one is fake, I shall compensate you for ten of them/fig. (of goods) 100% genuine
replacement guaranteed if not genuine/fig. authentic
lit. from head to tail (idiom); thoroughgoing/through and through/out and out/from top to bottom
to steal sb's valuable item and substitute a similar-looking but worthless item/to sell a fake for the genuine article/to palm off
